column1: None of these findings really suprised me although I thought the Genetic Counselor salary was intriguiging for only needing a Master's Degree. Additionally, I would have thought it'd be lower and then offer
an increase in pay as you spend more time in that position.
I ranked these jobs mostly based on my interest in them, but also their pay and degree requirements. I like data but I appreciate working with it in more scientific fields, so
I stuck to jobs that were in that area. Not all of them pertain to data, but as someone with an interest in science, I felt they were viable options.
This might somewhat explain why I have my top three as Epidemiologist, Optometrist, and Statistician. Whether they were in person or remote did not influence my ranking as much.
I most truly went by whether or not I would enjoy my work in that position, but having a good salary range is important to me. Considering degree requirements
was also in my criteria because I would prefer to not spend a majority of my life in school. However, it is beneficial to understand what education is required
for these positions so that I can plan my life accordingly.
